title: Citi Searches for Top Colombian Micro Entrepreneurs
summary: Bogotá, Colombia – Citibank Colombia and International Action "Acción Internacional" recently announced a competition for the 2011 Citi-Accion Colombian Micro entrepreneurship Awards, which recognize the recurring efforts of Colombian small business owners who promote entrepreneurship in the country. The awards cover four categories: commerce, services, production, and community banks - rural solidarity groups. Since its inception, the awards have contributed to the growth of 66 Colombian microentrepreneurs, their families and communities.
tag-1: Citi Searches for Top Colombian Micro Entrepreneurs
tag-3: Bogotá, Colombia – Citibank Colombia and International Action "Acción Internacional" recently announced a competition for the 2011 Citi-Accion Colombian Micro entrepreneurship Awards, which recognize the recurring efforts of Colombian small business owners who promote entrepreneurship in the country. The awards cover four categories: commerce, services, production, and community banks - rural solidarity groups. Since its inception, the awards have contributed to the growth of 66 Colombian microentrepreneurs, their families and communities.
tag-4: To participate in the contest, microentrepreneurs must be nominated before September 30 by organizations that provide business development services, or other micro entrepreneurial groups. The goal is to highlight projects with strong results and potential for growth.
tag-5: "Supporting microentrepreneurs is part of our social investment objective. It is a consequence of our commitment to fostering economic empowerment and focusing on value-added initiatives that pertain to the communities where we live and work. We believe that entrepreneurship is one of the growth engines of our country, and we will continue making investments to support it," said Bernardo Noreña, CCO Citibank Colombia.
tag-6: The prize, which will be awarded in November to four microentrepreneurs from different regions of the country, also includes a grant of 75 million pesos for the top two winner, in the commerce, services and production categories. The winner from the community banks - rural solidarity groups' category will receive a business management training course provided by International Action.
tag-8: The selection criteria includes: metrics for innovation for start-up businesses, the ability to overcome challenges, and product quality. These skills were certainly demonstrated by the 2010 winner in the production category, Amalfi Guata Campo, who owns Agroarte, a worm-breeding and silk products manufacturing microenterprise located in El Tambo, Cauca.
tag-9: Amalfi started her business 16 years ago, and after attending worm-breeding training sessions in Pereira and Popayan, she started manufacturing silk products with plans to export to Germany and the U.S. in the near future. "This award allowed me to invest in raw materials, mainly worms' larvae, and I was able to expand the incubation process' infrastructure. My production capacity increased accordingly, and so my business began to grow. The prize was extremely useful," said Amalfi Guata.
tag-10: In order to nominate candidates for the award, microcredit lending organizations must choose among microenterprises that have or have had a micro-credit up to a maximum of 10 million pesos, issued by microcredit-lending groups such as banks, business finance companies, financial cooperatives, microfinance non-governmental organizations (NGOs) or compensation funds.
tag-11: They can also nominate candidates who have had business development services in training (business management or technical), consulting and/or technical assistance; delivered by colleges, corporate training centers, technical training centers at the workplace, unions, compensation funds, and NGOs having cooperatives and training divisions.
